message: It’s known the conquest ended in 651 with Shah Yazdegerd III‘s death. And at least match the flag of belligerents with commanders.
Islam was long the majority faith in Iran before 1300AD and the Rashidun didn’t kill priests.
/* Muslim conquest of Persia */ new section
It was the dominant long before the late Middle Ages.
It ended in 651 and it was a conquest against the Sassanian Empire.
Added flags, alternative name and the empire had fall by 651.
/* Siege of Bahurasīr */Source needed for that sector.
Cite a battle after 651 involving this conflict and the map is of West Asia not Southwest Asia stop reverting edits that are historically incorrect.
/* Conquest of Mesopotamia (633–638) */Adding the siege of the Sassanian capital.
There wasn’t a reconquest of any sort.

page: Mongol invasion of the Khwarazmian Empire
message: He wasn’t killed in this invasion.
Abd Allah ibn Sa'd was a commander of the campaign.
The conquest was secured by the Siege of Alexandria (641).
The Seljuks held it for quite some time.

/* Notes */ Added another estimate by the author later in the book on page 64.  Also removed the four to one number in cnote m, as this refers to a period before the battle in the text, not during the battle.  Since Nicolle twice gives a number between 15,000-25,000 for the Byzantine side, and between 20,000-40,000 for the Arab side, this would not be possible.
